place.name: HERRIARD
place.gazetteerText: HERRIARD, a parish in Basingstoke district, Hants; 4½ miles SSE of Basingstoke r. station. It contains the tything of Southrope; and its post town is Basingstoke. Acres, 2, 963. Real property, £2, 505. Pop., 439. Houses, 84. The property is not much divided. The manor, with Herriard House, belongs to F. J. E. Jervoise, Esq. Herriard House was built in the time of Queen Anne; is an elegant mansion; and stands in a picturesque park, about 7 miles in circuit. The living is a vicarage in the diocese of Winchester. Value, £147. Patron, F. J. E. Jervoise, Esq. The church is ancient, but good. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
